page.title: 01Cushendun
page.content: Cushendun village lies in picturesque surroundings in pinewoods at the lower end of Glendun. Whereas modern local authority housing has been sited on river terraces further upstream towards the hamlet of Knocknacarry, the core of the village in the former O'Neill estate was built immediately in the sandy grassland that slopes to the pebbly beach and the tiny harbour. The layout and architecture ws the product of the imaginative of eccentric, mind of Clough Williams Ellis, the builder of Portmeinon in Snowdonia, and as such its typically English styles seem out of place here. Nevertheless the villageand its environs have undoubted charm and are regular destinations for summer tourists. The village is now a conversation area owned by the National Trust.
